basics.name: Cam Bui
basics.label: Fullstack Devops Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced software engineer with expertise in DevOps, cloud platforms, and full-stack development. Let's talk about clearing developer friction to make room for communication and collaboration.

work.name: Thoughtworks, Inc.
work.summary: Build and maintain data pipelines and platforms, across frontend, backend, and cloud infrastructure. Worked closely with cross-functional teams to enable scientists, healthcare providers, operations specialists, and more to build tools to understand their data.
highlights: Collaborated with product, UX, developer, and stakeholder teams to design, deploy, and maintain distributed data pipelines with Javascript, React, Python, PostgreSQL, AWS, Azure stacks to add new capabilities to existing platforms.
automating security and compliance checks with automated testing as part of the CI/CD pipelines,
configuring and maintaining Argo CD to enable GitOps-managed test resources
and standardizing exception handling and error monitoring practices

Advocated for devops and platform engineering best practices to enable developers to self-ship safe code faster by automating security and compliance check as part of the CI/CD pipelines, configuring and maintaining Argo CD to enable GitOps-managed test resources, and standardizing exception handling and error monitoring practices.
Presented relatable software & engineering concepts at lunch'n'learn series to teams of various expertises.

work.name: Invitae, Inc.
work.summary: Processed patient health records and streamline data quality checks.
highlights: Streamlined data quality checks by building reports that cross reference databases during launch of newly-acquired products.

work.name: Action & Consciousness Lab, San Francisco State University
work.summary: Proposed, conducted, and analyzed behavioral experiments on automatic visual and syntactic processing.
highlights: Conducted, and analyzed behavioral experiments on automatic visual and syntactic processing. https://doi.org/10.1037/cns0000208.

work.name: HPW, San Francisco State University
work.summary: Intern in the inaugural cohort of the Health, Promotions, and Wellness unit at SFSU
highlights: Conducted focus groups for the newly-built Mashouf Wellness Center (MWC) that found that students on this commuter campus overwhelmingly needed places to rest. In 2024, MWC launched the Zen Den, a free space to nap at SFSU.
